<div class="mw-body-content mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Capital city of England and the United Kingdom</div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1033289096">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}</style><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">This article is about the capital city of England and the United Kingdom. For other uses, see <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/London_(disambiguation)" title="London (disambiguation)">London (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

<p><b>London</b> is the capital and <a href="/wiki/List_of_urban_areas_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="List of urban areas in the United Kingdom">largest city</a> of <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">England</a> and the <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>, with a population of just over 9 million.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10"><a href="#cite_note-10">[9]</a></sup> It stands on the <a href="/wiki/River_Thames" title="River Thames">River Thames</a> in south-east England at the head of a 50-mile (80 km) <a href="/wiki/Estuary" title="Estuary">estuary</a> down to the <a href="/wiki/North_Sea" title="North Sea">North Sea</a>, and has been a major settlement for two millennia.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-london_001_11-0"><a href="#cite_note-london_001-11">[10]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/City_of_London" title="City of London">City of London</a>, its ancient core and <a href="/wiki/Financial_centre" title="Financial centre">financial centre</a>, was founded by the <a href="/wiki/Roman_Empire" title="Roman Empire">Romans</a> as <i><a href="/wiki/Londinium" title="Londinium">Londinium</a></i> and retains boundaries close to its medieval ones.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12"><a href="#cite_note-12">[note 1]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13"><a href="#cite_note-13">[11]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/City_of_Westminster" title="City of Westminster">City of Westminster</a>, to the west of the City of London, has for centuries hosted the national <a href="/wiki/Government_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Government of the United Kingdom">government</a> and <a href="/wiki/Parliament_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Parliament of the United Kingdom">parliament</a>.  Since the 19th century,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Mills2_14-0"><a href="#cite_note-Mills2-14">[12]</a></sup> the name "London" has also referred to the <a href="/wiki/Metropolis" title="Metropolis">metropolis</a> around this core, historically split between the <a href="/wiki/Counties_of_England" title="Counties of England">counties</a> of <a href="/wiki/Middlesex" title="Middlesex">Middlesex</a>, <a href="/wiki/Essex" title="Essex">Essex</a>, <a href="/wiki/Surrey" title="Surrey">Surrey</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kent" title="Kent">Kent</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Hertfordshire" title="Hertfordshire">Hertfordshire</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15"><a href="#cite_note-15">[13]</a></sup> which largely comprises <a href="/wiki/Greater_London" title="Greater London">Greater London</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-16"><a href="#cite_note-16">[14]</a></sup> governed by the <a href="/wiki/Greater_London_Authority" title="Greater London Authority">Greater London Authority</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-17"><a href="#cite_note-17">[note 2]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-politics_uk2_18-0"><a href="#cite_note-politics_uk2-18">[15]</a></sup>
</p><p>As one of the world's major <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Global_cities" title="Global cities">global cities</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-19"><a href="#cite_note-19">[16]</a></sup> London exerts a strong influence on its arts, entertainment, <a href="/wiki/Fashion_capital" title="Fashion capital">fashion</a>, commerce and finance, education, health care, <a href="/wiki/Media_in_London" title="Media in London">media</a>, science and technology, <a href="/wiki/Tourism_in_London" title="Tourism in London">tourism</a>, and transport and communications.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20"><a href="#cite_note-20">[17]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-21"><a href="#cite_note-21">[18]</a></sup> Its GDP (€801.66 billion in 2017) makes it the largest <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Urban_economy" title="Urban economy">urban economy</a> in Europe,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22"><a href="#cite_note-22">[19]</a></sup> and it is one of the major financial centres in the world. As of 2021, London had the most millionaires of any city.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-23"><a href="#cite_note-23">[20]</a></sup> With Europe's largest concentration of higher education institutions,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-london2_24-0"><a href="#cite_note-london2-24">[21]</a></sup> it is home to some of the highest-ranked academic institutions in the world—<a href="/wiki/Imperial_College_London" title="Imperial College London">Imperial College London</a> in <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Natural_sciences" title="Natural sciences">natural</a> and <a href="/wiki/Applied_science" title="Applied science">applied sciences</a>, the <a href="/wiki/London_School_of_Economics" title="London School of Economics">London School of Economics</a> in <a href="/wiki/Social_science" title="Social science">social sciences</a>, and the comprehensive <a href="/wiki/University_College_London" title="University College London">University College London</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-25"><a href="#cite_note-25">[22]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-26"><a href="#cite_note-26">[23]</a></sup> London has the <a href="/wiki/List_of_busiest_city_airport_systems_by_passenger_traffic" title="List of busiest city airport systems by passenger traffic">busiest city airport system</a> in the world<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-27"><a href="#cite_note-27">[24]</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/London_Underground" title="London Underground">London Underground</a> is the oldest <a href="/wiki/Rapid_transit" title="Rapid transit">rapid transit</a> system in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28"><a href="#cite_note-28">[25]</a></sup> London is one of the <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_by_international_visitors" title="List of cities by international visitors">most-visited cities in the world</a> and is home to the most 5-star hotels of any city.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-29"><a href="#cite_note-29">[26]</a></sup>
</p><p>London's diverse cultures encompass over 300 languages.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-london_006_30-0"><a href="#cite_note-london_006-30">[27]</a></sup> The mid-2018 population of Greater London of about 9 million<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ons-pop-estimates_6-1"><a href="#cite_note-ons-pop-estimates-6">[5]</a></sup> made it Europe's <a href="/wiki/List_of_European_cities_by_population_within_city_limits" title="List of European cities by population within city limits">third-most populous city</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-largest_city_eu_31-0"><a href="#cite_note-largest_city_eu-31">[28]</a></sup> accounting for 13.4% of the population of the United Kingdom<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-32"><a href="#cite_note-32">[29]</a></sup> and over 16% of the population of England. The <a href="/wiki/Greater_London_Built-up_Area" title="Greater London Built-up Area">Greater London Built-up Area</a> is the <a href="/wiki/List_of_urban_areas_in_Europe" title="List of urban areas in Europe">fourth-most populous</a> in Europe with about 9.8 million inhabitants at the 2011 census.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Demographia_33-0"><a href="#cite_note-Demographia-33">[30]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-urbanpopulation_34-0"><a href="#cite_note-urbanpopulation-34">[31]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/London_metropolitan_area" title="London metropolitan area">London metropolitan area</a> is the <a href="/wiki/List_of_metropolitan_areas_in_Europe" title="List of metropolitan areas in Europe">third-most populous</a> in Europe with about 14 million inhabitants in 2016,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-35"><a href="#cite_note-35">[note 3]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-appsso.eurostat.ec.europa.eu_show_5-1"><a href="#cite_note-appsso.eurostat.ec.europa.eu_show-5">[4]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-gla-plan-2015_36-0"><a href="#cite_note-gla-plan-2015-36">[32]</a></sup> granting London the status of a <a href="/wiki/Megacity" title="Megacity">megacity</a>.
</p><p>London has four <a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">World Heritage Sites</a>: the <a href="/wiki/Tower_of_London" title="Tower of London">Tower of London</a>; <a href="/wiki/Kew_Gardens" title="Kew Gardens">Kew Gardens</a>; the combined <a href="/wiki/Palace_of_Westminster" title="Palace of Westminster">Palace of Westminster</a>, <a href="/wiki/Westminster_Abbey" title="Westminster Abbey">Westminster Abbey</a>, and <a href="/wiki/St_Margaret%27s,_Westminster" title="St Margaret's, Westminster">St Margaret's Church</a>; and also the historic settlement in <a href="/wiki/Greenwich" title="Greenwich">Greenwich</a>, where the <a href="/wiki/Royal_Observatory,_Greenwich" title="Royal Observatory, Greenwich">Royal Observatory, Greenwich</a> defines the <a href="/wiki/Prime_meridian_(Greenwich)" title="Prime meridian (Greenwich)">prime meridian</a> (0° <a href="/wiki/Longitude" title="Longitude">longitude</a>) and <a href="/wiki/Greenwich_Mean_Time" title="Greenwich Mean Time">Greenwich Mean Time</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-london_005_37-0"><a href="#cite_note-london_005-37">[33]</a></sup> Other landmarks include <a href="/wiki/Buckingham_Palace" title="Buckingham Palace">Buckingham Palace</a>, the <a href="/wiki/London_Eye" title="London Eye">London Eye</a>, <a href="/wiki/Piccadilly_Circus" title="Piccadilly Circus">Piccadilly Circus</a>, <a href="/wiki/St_Paul%27s_Cathedral" title="St Paul's Cathedral">St Paul's Cathedral</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tower_Bridge" title="Tower Bridge">Tower Bridge</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Trafalgar_Square" title="Trafalgar Square">Trafalgar Square</a>. London has <a href="/wiki/List_of_museums_in_London" title="List of museums in London">many museums</a>, galleries, libraries and cultural venues, including the <a href="/wiki/British_Museum" title="British Museum">British Museum</a>, <a href="/wiki/National_Gallery" title="National Gallery">National Gallery</a>, <a href="/wiki/Natural_History_Museum,_London" title="Natural History Museum, London">Natural History Museum</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tate_Modern" title="Tate Modern">Tate Modern</a>, <a href="/wiki/British_Library" title="British Library">British Library</a>, and numerous <a href="/wiki/West_End_theatre" title="West End theatre">West End</a> theatres.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-38"><a href="#cite_note-38">[34]</a></sup> Important sporting events held in London include the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup_Final" title="FA Cup Final">FA Cup Final</a> (held annually at <a href="/wiki/Wembley_Stadium" title="Wembley Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>), <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Championships,_Wimbledon" title="The Championships, Wimbledon">Wimbledon Tennis Championships</a> and the <a href="/wiki/London_Marathon" title="London Marathon">London Marathon</a>. In <a href="/wiki/2012_Summer_Olympics" title="2012 Summer Olympics">2012</a>, London became the first city to host three <a href="/wiki/Summer_Olympic_Games" title="Summer Olympic Games">Summer Olympic Games</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IOC_39-0"><a href="#cite_note-IOC-39">[35]</a></sup>
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886046785">.mw-parser-output .toclimit-2 .toclevel-1 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-3 .toclevel-2 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-4 .toclevel-3 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-5 .toclevel-4 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-6 .toclevel-5 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-7 .toclevel-6 ul{display:none}</style><div class="toclimit-3"><div aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading" class="toc" id="toc" role="navigation"><input class="toctogglecheckbox" id="toctogglecheckbox" role="button" style="display:none" type="checkbox"/><div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>
